text: Yesterday I finished one of the two performance upgrades ("starting a new movie renders the initial template way too many times"). Not sure how much of an effect it had. I can do some benchmarking to figure that out, but I'm resting easier, at least, that we're not rendering the templates more than necessary.

The other performance upgrade ("Preview image is crap quality wise") is ongoing, and not blocked. Again, not entirely sure it'll have a huge effect, but I'm learning more about Core Graphics, so it's definitely a good thing to be doing.
Once both are wrapped up I'll issue a new build. It doesn't really make sense to do a new build for each, since they have such a minor effect on the user
I'm heading in shortly. Just need to stop by the hardware store and a sandwich shop
<@U02688JHZ> second performance upgrade completed! Building 3.0.15 for Crashlytics now
